de.awi.floenavigation.synchronization

Class SyncActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
          • android.app.Activity
            • de.awi.floenavigation.synchronization.SyncActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback

    public class SyncActivity
extends android.app.Activity
    This Activity runs the Synchronization Process between the App and the Sync Server. The Activity uses a separate Sync Class for each object which is to be synchronized. A Java RequestQueue is created and StringRequests are added to the Request Queue to push and Pull the Data from the Server. The Synchronization process is Asynchronous which means that each Sync Class's Push and Pull method run asynchronously and the Synchronization is not done in a specific order. The Activity is configured to read the data from the Database tables and push the data to the Sync Server on pressing the Start button on the UI and then clearing the local Database tables and pulling fresh data from the Sync Server on Pressing the Pull Button on the UI.

    The Activity uses the Configuration Parameters DatabaseHelper.sync_server_hostname and DatabaseHelper.sync_server_port to connect to the Sync Server.

    See Also:
    RequestQueue, XmlPullParser, XmlPullParserFactory, StringRequest

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Default onCreate method of the Activity. Creates the RequestQueue and XmlPullParser. Reads the DatabaseHelper.sync_server_hostname and DatabaseHelper.sync_server_port from the local Database. Initializes the Sync Objects by passing them the created RequestQueue and XmlPullParser and then waits for User to push the Start Synchronization button.
        Overrides:
        onCreate in class android.app.Activity
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState -
        Throws:
        org.xmlpull.v1.XmlPullParserException

      • onClickStartSync

        public void onClickStartSync(android.view.View view)
        Callback function for Start Sync Button. Reads the Sync Server parameters from the database and tries to ping the Sync Server. If ping fails it displays an error message and and the Synchronization process is not run. If Sync Server is available it changes the Screen layout, stops the background de.awi.floenavigation.servicess, and checks if the coordinate system is initialized. The NavigationBar at the bottom of the screen and the hard back button are disabled during this process.

        If the Coordinate System is already setup the DatabaseHelper.mobileStationTable is cleared and the data for the other tables is read from the local database and pushed in to the RequestQueue using the individual Sync Objects for each table. The Screen Layout is changed to show a waiting view with a Pull Button and isPushCompleted is set to true and isPullCompleted is set to false. If the Coordinate System is not setup, the Push process is skipped and the App tries to pull the data from the Sync Server. The Screen Layout is changed to show a Finish button and isPushCompleted is set to false and isPullCompleted is set to true.

        Parameters:
        view -

      • stopServices

        private void stopServices()
        Function to stop the background services and sets MainActivity.areServicesRunning to false.

      • clearMobileStationTable

        private void clearMobileStationTable()

        private void setBaseUrl(java.lang.String host,
                        java.lang.String port)
        Sets the Base URLs for pushing, pulling and deleting data on the Sync Server.
        Parameters:
        host - the hostname/IP of the Sync Serer
        port - the port used by the Sync Server

      • pingRequest

        private boolean pingRequest(java.lang.String host)
        Checks if the Sync Server is reachable on the network.
        Parameters:
        host - the hostname/IP of the Sync Server
        Returns:
        true if the Sync Server is reachable

      • onBackPressed

        public void onBackPressed()
        Overrides the normal back button behavior. If the backButtonEnabled is true it will return to MainActivity otherwise it will just show a Toast.
        Overrides:
        onBackPressed in class android.app.Activity

      • hideNavigationBar

        private void hideNavigationBar()
        Hides the hard Navigation buttons at the bottom of the tablet during Synchronization process

      • readParamsfromDatabase

        private boolean readParamsfromDatabase()
        Reads the DatabaseHelper.sync_server_hostname and DatabaseHelper.sync_server_port from the local Database.

      • onClickProgressBarButton

        public void onClickProgressBarButton(android.view.View view)
        Callback function for Start Pull from Server Button. If data has already been push to the RequestQueue, it starts adding the Pull requests to the RequestQueue and changes the layout to display the finish button. If Pull Requests have already been added to the the RequestQueue, that means the synchronization process is complete and it restarts the background Services and returns to the AdminPageActivity.
        Parameters:
        view -

      • pullDatafromServer

        private void pullDatafromServer()
        Clears the local database and starts adding the Pull requests to the requestQueue for each database table which is to be synced.

      • readMobileStations

        public void readMobileStations()
        Reads the Table and inserts the data from all the Columns of the Table in to their respective HashMap.
        Throws:
        android.database.sqlite.SQLiteException - In case of error in reading database.

      • sendMobileStations

        public void sendMobileStations()
        Creates StringRequests as per the size of mmsiData data extracted from the local database and inserts all the requests in the RequestQueue A Stringrequest for pushing the data is registered and added to the requestQueue. callback function Response.Listener#onResponse(Object) notifies whether the request was successful or not If it is unsuccessful or the connection is not established Response.Listener#error(VolleyError) gets called
